intro: Leptorkis macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited leptorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, umbellate flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that are typically red or orange in color, which serve as a food source for various wildlife species. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems in which it is found.
